26.title: Roma, la Loba
26.author: Enrique Lihn.

publication info.place: Originally published in Un Cómic. Santiago de Chile

notes: Summary (from OCLC): Noted for his drawings, Enrique Lihn (b. Chile) crafted his own challenge and created this comic book/graphic novel for adults with chilensimas onomatopoeia and ebullient figures. It is a "comic novel," according to the author's own rating, with story lines and characters that contain the ominous vibe collective neurosis and prosaic delusions.

41.heading: Roman, Annette.
41.title: B.O.D.Y.
41.author: story and art by Ao Mimori ; English adaptation, Kelly Sue DeConnick ; translation, Joe Yamazaki ; editor, Annette Roman.
notes: Summary (from publisher's web site via SkyRiver): "Everyone thinks 16-year-old Ryoko has weird taste in guys because she can't stop drooling over Ryu, the strong silent type who sits next to her in class. When she discovers he works for a host club
where women actually pay men to date them
will she finally wise up? Only one thing's for sure in B.O.D.Y.
you can't put a price on love!"

42.heading: Roman, Annette.
42.title: Black & White
42.author: story and art by Taiyo Matsumoto ; English adaptation by Annette Roman.
notes: Summary: Street urchins Black and White have skyscraper-sized chips on their shoulders, but are fiercely loyal to each other and quick to avenge any slight. The town and police are afraid of them. Then Rat, the crime boss, returns from prison.
Translated from Japanese to English by Lillian Olsen.

49.title: Pikachu Shocks Back
49.author: story and art by Toshihiro Ono.
notes: "Rewrite, Annette Roman ; translator and editor, William Flanagan."

Summary: Ash Ketchum wants to be the greatest Pokémon master and decides to train Pikachu to be his first Pokémon partner. Pikachu gets separated from Ash. Charmander, Squirtle and Kangaskhan are called upon to help defeat Team Rocket and return Pikachu to Ash.

62.heading: Roman, Danilo.

63.heading: Roman, Dave.
63.title: Agnes Quill : an Anthology of Mystery
63.author: all transcripts written by Dave Roman ; illustrations by Jason Ho ; lettered by John Green.
notes: Summary (from SkyRiver): Set in Legerdemain, a congested, fog-filled, cobblestone-paved Victorian city built around a cemetery the size of Central Park, Agnes Quill is the 16-year-old grandchild of a once famous detective. With a natural ability to communicate with the dead, she has taken over the family business of helping souls find their way in the afterlife and often uncovering the mystery of how they ended up there.

64.heading: Roman, Dave.
64.title: Borrowed Magic
64.author: Dave Roman, writer ; John Green, artist.
notes: Originally published in comic book form as Quicken forbidden #'s 1-5.

"What if, when Alice came back from Wonderland, Wonderland came back with her? That is the situation sixteen-year-old Jax Epoch faces when she falls through an interdimensional portal and steals some magic armor and a book older than time. Join Jax as she confronts her evil twin, gets dumped by her boyfriend, flies on a dragon through the streets of New York City, befriends a robot and awakes an unstoppable force of destruction known only as the Quicken."

65.heading: Roman, Dave.
65.title: Friends of Lulu Presents Broad Appeal : an Anthology of Comics for Everyone
65.author: editor, Dave Roman.
notes: "The New York chapter of Friends of Lulu presents an anthology of illustrated stories that showcase the diversity of female artists writing and drawing comics today. From dramatic mystery and humorous fantasy to insightful narratives, this unique collection offers something for everyone. Also inside: Candid interviews with women who proudly consider comics their day job!"

105.heading: Roman Bashing.
105.title: Asterix and the Picts
105.author: written by Jean-Yves Ferri ; illustrated by Didier Conrad ; translated by Anthea Bell ; color by Thierry Mébarki, Murielle Leroi, Raphaël Delerue.
notes: "When Asterix and Obelix rescue a mysterious Pict named MacAroon, they must journey to Caledonia, now Scotland, to return him to his lady love, Camomilla, the adopted daughter of the old king. However, the treacherous chieftain, MacCabaeus, plans to marry her and claim the throne, with the help of the Romans! What with caber-tossing, bagpipes, malted water and an enormous otter in the loch, can the Gauls reunite MacAroon and Camomilla and enjoy some Roman-bashing along the way?"
Translation of: Astérix chez les Pictes.

106.heading: Roman Candles.
106.title: "The Culinary Equivalent of a Roman Candle"
106.author: K
notes: Summary: A cake for the 4th of July, with a Tabasco center and Maalox frosting.

107.heading: Roman Catholics.
107.title: Are Roman Catholics Christians?
107.author: by J
notes: Comic books, strips, etc. I. Chick, Jack T. II. Chick Publications. k. Roman Catholics. Call no.: PN6728.C47A7 1985

108.heading: Roman Centurions.
108.title: Light Brigade
108.author: Peter J
108.appears_in: Tomasi, story and words ; Peter Snejbjerg, artist ; Bjarne Hansen, colorist ; Ken Lopez, Rob Leigh, letters.
notes: "Originally published in single magazine form in The Light Brigade #1-4."

Summary (from SkyRiver): The German troops who overrun an isolated pocket of U.S. soldiers during the winter of 1944-1945 are worse than Nazis; they're the descendants of fallen angels who now see a chance to steal the Sword of God. The surviving Americans, led by an immortal Roman centurion in disguise, must fight these supernatural, almost-indestructable foes.

136.heading: Le Roman de Renart--Reviews.
136.title: "Le Roman de Renart"
136.author: Gérard de Cortanze
136.appears_in: p. 56 in Les Cahiers de la Bande Dessinée, no. 64 (July/Aug. 1985).

137.title: "Le Roman Dessiné : un 'Film en Planches Dessinées'"
137.author: Sylviette Giet
137.appears_in: p. 44-51 in 9e Art : les Cahiers du Musée de la Bande Dessinée, no. 6 (Jan. 2001).
notes: Begins: "Parmi les multiples bandes dessinées proposées au lectorat féminin, un partie d'entre elles relèvent d'un sous-genre spécifique, désigné par ses éditeurs comme 'roman dessiné'. Un sous-genre qui sera un des grands succès de la presse d'après-guerre, et fondera celui de la 'presse du cœur'. Mais ce roman sentimental en images tend à se présenter come substitut de film plus que comme bande dessinée."

English summary (from page 150): "A Film in Comic Strip Form. Before being replace by the fumetti, the 'graphic novel' which presented itself as a substitute for a film, constituted an important part of romance publications in post war years. Sylvette Giet recounts the brief acme of this genre that originated in Italy and in which some great artists such as Walter Molino distinguished themselves."

141.heading: Roman Dirge's Lenore.
141.title: Lenore : Purple Nurples
141.author: written, drawn and colored by Roman Dirge.
notes: Horror genre, Lenore being a zombie.

144.heading: Roman Empire.
144.title: "Alpha, the Slave Pirate" 8 p. in Pirates Comics, no. 1
144.author: [No author]
notes: About a Greek slave, in the time of the Roman Empire.

146.heading: Roman Empire.
146.title: Beyond the Wall
146.author: writer, Matt Venne ; artist, Gordon Purcell ; colorist, Moose Baumann ; letterer, Neil Uyetake ; editor, Scott Dunbar.
notes: "It's the third century A.D. and the tentacles of the Roman Empire have entwined the British Isles. Marcus Malleoulus, veteran of countless military campaigns, has been betrayed by the whim of a tyrant. Now, banished beyond Hadrian's Wall, he faces untold dangers as he fights his way back, determined to survive until revenge is his."

notes: Summary: "Travel back to the glorious days of the Roman Empire, when a man's fate hung on the position of a thumb!"

151.heading: Roman Empire.
151.title: "Thunder in the Skies"
151.author: story, Ron Fortier ; pencils, Christopher Jones ; letters & inks, Gary Kato
151.appears_in: 29 p. in The Boston Bombers, no. 2 (1990).
notes: "Last issue, we were introduced to the world of Indra Devine and the Boston Bombers. It is a world where Jesus was female and the Jews accepted her as the Messiah. The Catholic Church is centered in Jerusalem and has a female Pope. The Roman Empire has survived into current day and is now know as Rome South Africa. World War II never happened and the League of Nations became a powerful and strong military force. Indra and her Bombers are official agents of the League."

notes: Begins: "Early in the third century Caligula had ordered the torture and murder of all Christians who refused to renounce Christ and worship the Roman gods. 176.heading: Roman-Occupied Palestine.
176.title: Les Chatiments de la Mer Morte
176.author: Fred Le Berre, Michel Rouge.
notes: Summary (from OCLC): Le juge Shimon de Samarie est samaritain de naissance, mais a été éduqué à Rome. Il est considéré comme juif par les Romains et comme Romain par sa famille, ce qui ne l'aide pas dans son métier. Un séisme secoue le Temple et un homme est retrouvé mort à l'intérieur d'un bâtiment. Pourtant, il n'a pas été victime du tremblement de terre. Shimon enquête sur ce meurtre et découvre des secrets qui bouleversent son entourage. Cette enquête en deux parties reconstitue l'atmosphère de cette époque de la Palestine. Le scénario est bien ficelé et le graphisme au trait léger arbore des couleurs chaudes.
Detective and historical genres, set in Roman-occupied Palestine.

"Imagine a race of immortal beings possessed of seemingly limitless superhuman abilities including energy projection, strength and flight. Once worshipped as gods, this fantastic group left Earth to explore the stars after warring with the Greek, Roman and Norse pantheons for supremacy over mankind."

notes: "From the New York Times best selling author of BONE comes a stark, gritty sci-fi series about a dimension-jumping art thief, a man unplugged from the world racing through space & time searching for his next big score
and trying to escape his past."

272.heading: "Romance at the Speed of Light."
272.title: RASL
272.author: by Jeff Smith.

contents.title: Romance at the speed of light
The lost journals of Nikola Tesla.

notes: "Jeff Smith, art direction ; Steve Hamaker, colorist ; Tom Gaadt, additional color & design."
"Parts of this book were originally serialized in the comic book RASL."
Includes bibliographical references (page 3 of unnumbered sequence at end).

Summary (from OCLC): A dimension-jumping art thief races through space and time in search of his next job but becomes distracted by an assassin pursuing him using the same technology he uses to jump across dimensions.

273.heading: "Romance Baits the Hook" 5 p. in My Romantic Adventures, no.
273.author: [No author]
